name: get_chat_conversations
description: Retrieves all Quick Suite chat conversation history within the specified time range. Use this to analyze chat interactions, troubleshoot issues, view user queries and AI responses, check conversation flow, examine agent and flow usage. Returns: conversation_id, timestamp, user_message, system_response, status_code, agent_id, flow_id. Keywords: chat history, conversations, messages, queries, responses, dialogue, interactions, chat logs, user questions, AI answers.

hours.description: Time range in hours to look back (default: 24, max: 720 for 30 days)

name: get_chat_errors
description: Identifies and analyzes Quick Suite chat failures and errors. Use this to troubleshoot chat problems, find error patterns, identify failing agents or flows, debug issues. Returns: error conversations with status codes (4xx, 5xx), error messages, affected users, agent_id, flow_id, timestamps. Keywords: errors, failures, bugs, issues, problems, exceptions, error codes, failed chats, broken conversations, troubleshooting.

hours.description: Time range in hours to look back (default: 24)

name: get_chat_performance
description: Analyzes Quick Suite chat performance metrics and success rates. Use this to monitor chat health, track successful interactions, measure system reliability. Returns: total successful requests, success rate percentage, performance statistics. Keywords: performance, metrics, success rate, reliability, uptime, health check, system status, chat quality.

hours.description: Time range in hours to analyze (default: 24)

name: get_user_feedback
description: Retrieves user feedback on Quick Suite chat responses including thumbs up/down ratings. Use this to understand user satisfaction, identify problematic responses, find areas for improvement. Returns: feedback entries with sentiment (Useful/Not Useful), reasons for negative feedback, user comments, timestamps. Keywords: feedback, ratings, thumbs up, thumbs down, user satisfaction, sentiment, reviews, comments, user experience, quality.

hours.description: Time range in hours to retrieve feedback (default: 24)

feedback_type.description: Filter by feedback type: 'positive', 'negative', or 'all' (default: all)

name: get_feedback_summary
description: Provides aggregated Quick Suite user feedback statistics and trends. Use this for high-level satisfaction analysis, tracking feedback trends over time, measuring overall user sentiment. Returns: total feedback count, positive/negative breakdown, satisfaction percentage, common feedback reasons. Keywords: feedback summary, satisfaction metrics, aggregate feedback, feedback trends, overall sentiment, user happiness, feedback statistics.

hours.description: Time range in hours for aggregation (default: 24)

name: get_agent_hours_usage
description: Tracks Quick Suite agent hours consumption by service and subscription type. Use this to monitor usage limits, track Professional vs Enterprise hours, identify high-usage services, forecast capacity needs. Returns: total hours used, breakdown by subscription type (Professional/Enterprise), hours by service, remaining capacity. Keywords: agent hours, usage, consumption, capacity, limits, Professional hours, Enterprise hours, service usage, billing, quotas.

hours.description: Time range in hours to analyze usage (default: 24)

name: search_chat_by_query
description: Searches Quick Suite chat conversations for specific keywords or phrases. Use this to find conversations about specific topics, locate error messages, search for user questions, find mentions of features or issues. Returns: matching conversations with highlighted search terms, user messages, system responses, timestamps. Keywords: search, find, lookup, query, keyword search, text search, conversation search, message search, find chats.

search_query.description: Text to search for in chat messages (case-insensitive)

hours.description: Time range in hours to search (default: 24)

name: get_dashboard_metrics
description: Retrieves QuickSight dashboard performance metrics including view counts and load times. Use this to monitor dashboard usage, identify slow dashboards, track popular dashboards, optimize performance. Returns: per-dashboard view counts, average load times in milliseconds, dashboard IDs. Keywords: dashboards, views, load time, performance, dashboard usage, dashboard metrics, visualization performance, BI dashboards.

hours.description: Time range in hours for metrics (default: 24)

name: get_ingestion_metrics
description: Monitors QuickSight SPICE dataset ingestion statistics and health. Use this to track data refresh success, identify ingestion failures, monitor data pipeline health, analyze ingestion performance. Returns: per-dataset ingestion counts, error counts, latency, row counts, success rates. Keywords: ingestion, data refresh, SPICE, datasets, data loading, ETL, data pipeline, ingestion errors, data updates.

hours.description: Time range in hours for ingestion metrics (default: 24)

name: get_visual_metrics
description: Analyzes QuickSight visual (chart/graph) performance and error rates. Use this to identify slow-loading visuals, find broken charts, optimize visual performance, troubleshoot rendering issues. Returns: per-visual load times, error counts, visual IDs, dashboard IDs, sheet IDs. Keywords: visuals, charts, graphs, visual performance, chart errors, rendering, visual load time, broken visuals.

hours.description: Time range in hours for visual metrics (default: 24)

name: get_knowledge_base_metrics
description: Tracks Quick Suite knowledge base (unstructured dataset) document statistics. Use this to monitor knowledge base size, track document indexing, check storage usage, verify data ingestion. Returns: per-instance document counts, total documents indexed, QuickInstanceId. Keywords: knowledge base, documents, indexing, unstructured data, KB metrics, document count, knowledge base size.

hours.description: Time range in hours for KB metrics (default: 24)

name: get_action_connector_metrics
description: Monitors Quick Suite action connector invocations and error rates. Use this to track connector usage, identify failing connectors, measure connector reliability, troubleshoot integration issues. Returns: per-connector invocation counts, error counts, success rates, connector IDs, connector types (Salesforce, MCP, etc). Keywords: action connectors, integrations, connector errors, API calls, third-party integrations, connector usage, connector failures.

hours.description: Time range in hours for connector metrics (default: 24)

name: get_spice_capacity
description: Monitors QuickSight SPICE storage capacity and usage. Use this to track SPICE consumption, avoid capacity limits, plan capacity upgrades, monitor storage trends. Returns: capacity limit in MB, consumed capacity, available capacity, usage percentage, status warnings. Keywords: SPICE capacity, storage, capacity limits, SPICE usage, storage quota, capacity planning, SPICE storage.

hours.description: Time range in hours for capacity metrics (default: 24)

name: get_aggregate_metrics
description: Provides comprehensive account-wide Quick Suite metrics across all resources. Use this for executive dashboards, overall system health monitoring, capacity planning, trend analysis. Returns: aggregate metrics for dashboards (views, load times), ingestions (counts, errors, latency), visuals (load times, errors), knowledge bases (document counts), action connectors (invocations, errors), SPICE capacity. Keywords: aggregate metrics, account metrics, overall metrics, system-wide metrics, summary metrics, total metrics, comprehensive metrics, all metrics.

hours.description: Time range in hours for aggregate metrics (default: 24)

name: get_active_users
description: Calculates Quick Suite active user metrics including DAU, WAU, and MAU. Use this to track user engagement, measure adoption, analyze user growth trends, monitor daily/weekly/monthly active users. Returns: daily active users (DAU), weekly active users (WAU), monthly active users (MAU), analysis period. Keywords: active users, DAU, WAU, MAU, user engagement, user adoption, user activity, user metrics, user count, engagement metrics.

days.description: Number of days for MAU calculation (default: 30)

name: get_asset_usage
description: Analyzes Quick Suite asset usage patterns including agents, flows, actions, and spaces. Returns usage counts and unique user counts per asset. Use this to identify most-used assets, track asset adoption, find unused assets, optimize asset deployment. Returns: asset name (with type prefix), asset type (AGENT/FLOW/ACTION/SPACE), usage count, user count. Keywords: asset usage, agents, flows, actions, spaces, asset adoption, most used assets, popular assets, asset metrics, agent usage, flow usage, action usage, space usage.

hours.description: Time range in hours for asset usage (default: 24)

name: get_quicksight_api_calls
description: Retrieves QuickSight API call history from CloudTrail including user identity and actions. Use this to audit API usage, track administrative changes, identify who created/modified resources, troubleshoot API issues, security auditing. Returns: API events with event names (CreateDashboard, UpdateDataSet, etc), user names, user types (Identity Center, IAM), timestamps, source IPs, error codes. Keywords: API calls, CloudTrail, audit logs, API history, administrative actions, user actions, API events, security audit, compliance, who did what.

hours.description: Time range in hours for API call history (default: 24, max: 2160 for 90 days)

event_name.description: Filter by specific API event name (e.g., CreateDashboard, UpdateDataSet)

user_name.description: Filter by specific user name or user ID

max_results.description: Maximum number of events to return (default: 50, max: 50)

name: get_log_schema
description: Discovers available fields and data types in all Quick Suite logs dynamically. Returns schemas for chat, feedback, and agent_hours logs. Use this to understand what fields are available before running custom analytics queries. Keywords: schema, fields, columns, structure, metadata, log structure, available fields, field discovery.

name: query_chat_analytics
description: Execute custom CloudWatch Insights queries on Quick Suite logs for advanced analytics. Use this for ad-hoc analysis when specialized tools don't fit your needs. First call get_log_schema to discover available fields, then construct CloudWatch Insights query. Supports aggregations, filtering, grouping, and sorting. Keywords: custom query, analytics, ad-hoc analysis, CloudWatch Insights, flexible query, custom analytics, advanced query.

log_type.description: Type of log to query: 'chat', 'feedback', or 'agent_hours'

query.description: CloudWatch Insights query string. Example: 'fields message_scope | stats count() by message_scope'

hours.description: Time range in hours to query (default: 24)
